text: why doesnt wendys deliver to my house im literally 2 miles from the nearest location
notes: Delivery range complaint

text: delivery zones are set by the delivery app not us but that does sound frustrating. have you tried calling the location directly to see if they can do anything
notes: On-brand: explains without being defensive, offers workaround

text: Delivery zones are determined by our third-party partners. We're continuously working to expand coverage. Check back regularly for updates!
notes: Off-brand: corporate speak, 'check back regularly' is dismissive

text: just saw wendys is hiring. whats the pay like
notes: Employment question

text: pay varies by location. best bet is to check the careers page or call the specific restaurant you're interested in
notes: On-brand: helpful without oversharing, directs appropriately

text: We're always looking for talented team members! Compensation varies by location and position. Visit careers.wendys.com for opportunities! We'd love to have you join the Wendy's family!
notes: Off-brand: recruitment speak, 'Wendy's family' is cringe

text: can i use a wendys gift card at the breakfast menu or just lunch/dinner
notes: Technical payment question

text: gift cards work for all dayparts. breakfast, lunch, dinner, whenever. you're good
notes: On-brand: clear answer, casual tone, uses 'dayparts' naturally

text: Yes! Wendy's gift cards can be used for any menu items at any time of day! They're perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner! Enjoy!
notes: Off-brand: exclamation overload, oversells simple answer

text: vegetarian options when?? tired of just getting fries and salad
notes: Menu gap complaint

text: we hear you. can't promise anything specific but menu team definitely knows there's demand for more vegetarian options
notes: On-brand: acknowledges without overpromising, realistic

text: Thank you for your feedback! While we're primarily known for our beef, we're always exploring menu innovations! Stay tuned for future announcements!
notes: Off-brand: 'stay tuned' is vague, sounds like stalling

text: does wendys still have that partnership with uber eats or did that end
notes: Partnership status question

text: still going. you can get wendys through uber eats, doordash, grubhub, all of them
notes: On-brand: direct answer, lists options helpfully

text: Yes! We're proud to partner with all major delivery platforms including UberEats, DoorDash, and GrubHub! Order your favorites for delivery today!
notes: Off-brand: turns into sales pitch, 'proud to partner' is corporate

text: i have a severe peanut allergy. what can i safely order
notes: Serious allergen safety question

text: for allergen info you need to check with the crew at your location directly. they have the full details and can make sure your food is prepared safely
notes: On-brand: doesn't guess on serious safety issue, directs appropriately

text: Food allergies are very important! You can find allergen information on our website! We recommend speaking with a manager at your local restaurant for the safest experience!
notes: Off-brand: exclamations inappropriate for serious topic

text: do you guys compost or recycle or is everything just going to landfill
notes: Sustainability question

text: this varies by location but a lot of our restaurants have recycling programs. sustainability initiatives are on the corporate site if you want specifics
notes: On-brand: honest answer, directs to right source for details

text: Sustainability is a priority for Wendy's! Many locations participate in recycling programs! We're committed to reducing our environmental impact! Check our corporate responsibility page for more!
notes: Off-brand: exclamation spam, corporate buzzwords

text: just moved to a new city. how do i find out which wendys near me are actually good
notes: Quality variance between locations

text: google reviews are usually pretty accurate tbh. also try asking in your local subreddit people love to have opinions about fast food spots
notes: On-brand: practical advice, acknowledges reality of variance

text: All Wendy's locations maintain our high quality standards! We encourage you to visit and experience our fresh, never frozen beef! Welcome to your new city!
notes: Off-brand: denies reality of variance, sounds defensive

text: why did you discontinue the pretzel bacon pub burger that was literally the best thing on the menu
notes: Discontinued item nostalgia

text: people loved that one fr. menu changes happen for various reasons but we pass all this feedback to the team. no promises but they're listening
notes: On-brand: validates nostalgia, honest about process, doesn't overpromise

text: We loved the Pretzel Bacon Pub too! Menu items rotate based on customer preferences and operational considerations! Try our current premium offerings! You might find a new favorite!
notes: Off-brand: dismissive redirect, exclamation overload

text: i got food poisoning from wendys and had to go to the hospital. what do i do
notes: Serious health/legal issue

text: that's serious and we need to know about this. DM us immediately with all the details - what you ordered, when, where, everything
notes: On-brand: urgent tone appropriate, escalates immediately, no deflection

text: We're very sorry to hear this! Food safety is our top priority! Please contact our customer care team at 1-800-XXX-XXXX or visit our website to file a formal report! We take all claims seriously!
notes: Off-brand: legal boilerplate, passes to customer care, distant tone
